artists.name: Grace Chang
artists.description: Hong Kong singer and actress whose legendary voice and swinging numbers defined Mandarin pop in the late 50s and 60s.

artists.name: Sinn Sisamouth
artists.description: Often called the 'Elvis of Cambodia,' he fused traditional Khmer melodies with Western rock and soul.

artists.name: Ros Serey Sothea
artists.description: A leading female voice of Cambodian rock, known for her soaring vocals over unique psych-tinged grooves.

artists.name: Salah Ragab
artists.description: Pioneer of Egyptian jazz, blending local rhythms with big-band arrangements.

artists.name: Kourosh Yaghmaei
artists.description: Pioneer of Iranian rock, mixing fuzzed-out guitars with Persian scales.

artists.name: Ajda Pekkan
artists.description: Pop diva whose 60s and 70s career bridged chanson, Turkish pop, and Western influences.

artists.name: Erkin Koray
artists.description: Considered the godfather of Anatolian rock, pushing fuzz guitar and Turkish folk into new territory.

artists.name: The Mops
artists.description: One of Japanâ€™s first true psychedelic rock bands, heavily inspired by American garage and psych.

artists.name: The Peanuts
artists.description: Twin-sister pop duo whose harmonies and playful style defined early J-pop and crossed into film.

artists.name: Abdou El Omari
artists.description: Keyboardist and composer known for hypnotic organ-driven Moroccan psych.

artists.name: Fadoul
artists.description: Cult figure who brought raw funk and rock energy into Moroccan grooves.

artists.name: R.D. Burman
artists.description: Legendary Bollywood composer who brought rock, funk, and electronic experimentation into Hindi cinema.

artists.name: S.D. Burman
artists.description: Cornerstone of Indian film music; fused folk traditions with modern orchestration.

artists.name: M.S. Viswanathan
artists.description: Titan of South Indian film music, pioneering lush orchestration and modern soundtracks in Tamil cinema.
